str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To flay, flog, scourge, beat. A primary verb; properly, to flay, i.e. to scourge, or to thrash.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
From hegeomai; a leader, i.e. Chief person of a province.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
